     538             : 
     539             : // Helper structs for the content->subdoc map
     540             : 
     541             : class SubDocMapEntry : public PLDHashEntryHdr
     542             : {

    1101           0 : IMPL_SHIM(nsILoadContext)
    1102           0 : IMPL_SHIM(nsIProgressEventSink)

    1107             : #undef IMPL_SHIM
    1108             : 
    1109             : #define IID_IS(_i) aIID.Equals(NS_GET_IID(_i))
    1110             : 
    1111             : #define TRY_SHIM(_i)                                                       \
    1112             :   PR_BEGIN_MACRO                                                           \
    1113             :     if (IID_IS(_i)) {                                                      \
    1114             :       nsCOMPtr<_i> real = do_GetInterface(mCallbacks);                     \
    1115             :       if (!real) {                                                         \
    1116             :         return NS_NOINTERFACE;                                             \
    1117             :       }                                                                    \
    1118             :       nsCOMPtr<_i> shim = new _i##Shim(this, real);                        \
    1119             :       shim.forget(aSink);                                                  \
    1120             :       return NS_OK;                                                        \
    1121             :     }                                                                      \
    1122             :   PR_END_MACRO
    1123             : 
    1124             : NS_IMETHODIMP
    1125           0 : nsExternalResourceMap::LoadgroupCallbacks::GetInterface(const nsIID & aIID,

    1129           0 :       (IID_IS(nsIPrompt) || IID_IS(nsIAuthPrompt) || IID_IS(nsIAuthPrompt2) ||

    1131           0 :     return mCallbacks->GetInterface(aIID, aSink);
    1132             :   }
    1133             : 
    1134           0 :   *aSink = nullptr;
    1135             :

    1231           1 : void nsIDocument::SelectorCache::NotifyExpired(SelectorCacheKey* aSelector)
    1232             : {
    1233             :   MOZ_ASSERT(NS_IsMainThread());
    1234             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aSelector);
    1235             : 
    1236             :   // There is no guarantee that this method won't be re-entered when selector
    1237             :   // matching is ongoing because "memory-pressure" could be notified immediately
    1238             :   // when OOM happens according to the design of nsExpirationTracker.
    1239             :   // The perfect solution is to delete the |aSelector| and its nsCSSSelectorList
    1240             :   // in mTable asynchronously.
    1241             :   // We remove these objects synchronously for now because NotifiyExpired() will
    1242             :   // never be triggered by "memory-pressure" which is not implemented yet in
    1243             :   // the stage 2 of mozalloc_handle_oom().
    1244             :   // Once these objects are removed asynchronously, we should update the warning
    1245             :   // added in mozalloc_handle_oom() as well.
    1246           1 :   RemoveObject(aSelector);
    1247           1 :   mTable.Remove(aSelector->mKey);
    1248           1 :   delete aSelector;
    1249           1 : }

    1497           1 :       uint32_t pageLoaded = 1;
    1498           1 :       Accumulate(Telemetry::MIXED_CONTENT_UNBLOCK_COUNTER, pageLoaded);
    1499             :       // Record the mixed content status of the docshell in Telemetry
    1500             :       enum {
    1501             :         NO_MIXED_CONTENT = 0, // There is no Mixed Content on the page
    1502             :         MIXED_DISPLAY_CONTENT = 1, // The page attempted to load Mixed Display Content
    1503             :         MIXED_ACTIVE_CONTENT = 2, // The page attempted to load Mixed Active Content
    1504             :         MIXED_DISPLAY_AND_ACTIVE_CONTENT = 3 // The page attempted to load Mixed Display & Mixed Active Content
    1505             :       };
    1506             : 
    1507           1 :       bool mixedActiveLoaded = GetHasMixedActiveContentLoaded();
    1508           1 :       bool mixedActiveBlocked = GetHasMixedActiveContentBlocked();

    1513           1 :       bool hasMixedDisplay = (mixedDisplayBlocked || mixedDisplayLoaded);
    1514           1 :       bool hasMixedActive = (mixedActiveBlocked || mixedActiveLoaded);
    1515             :

    1518             :         mixedContentLevel = MIXED_DISPLAY_AND_ACTIVE_CONTENT;

    2413             : static void

    2417             : {

    2430             :       return;

    2437             :       return;

    2442           1 :     if (!parentChannel) {
    2443             :       return;
    2444             :     }

    3926             :     return true;

    3929           1 :   if (!mPresShell) {

    3935             :     return false;  // Can't do anything smarter.
    3936             :   }

    3938           1 :   nsIFrame* displayRootFrame = nsLayoutUtils::GetDisplayRootFrame(frame);
    3939           1 :   if (!displayRootFrame) {
    3940             :     return false;  // Can't do anything smarter.
    3941             :   }

    3943           1 :   if (!displayRootFrame->DidPaintPresShell(mPresShell)) {
    3944             :     // We didn't get painted during the last paint, so we're not visible.
    3945             :     // Throttle. Note that because we have to paint this document at least
    3946             :     // once to unthrottle it, we will drop one requestAnimationFrame frame
    3947             :     // when a document that previously wasn't visible scrolls into view. This
    3948             :     // is acceptable since it would happen outside the viewport on APZ
    3949             :     // platforms and is unlikely to be human-perceivable on non-APZ platforms.
    3950             :     return true;
    3951             :   }
    3952             : 
    3953             :   // We got painted during the last paint, so run at full speed.
    3954           1 :   return false;
    3955             : }

    5660             : {

    7223             : void
    7224           1 : nsDocument::MaybeInitializeFinalizeFrameLoaders()
    7225             : {
    7226           1 :   if (mDelayFrameLoaderInitialization || mUpdateNestLevel != 0) {
    7227             :     // This method will be recalled when mUpdateNestLevel drops to 0,
    7228             :     // or when !mDelayFrameLoaderInitialization.
    7229           1 :     mFrameLoaderRunner = nullptr;
    7230           1 :     return;
    7231             :   }
    7232             : 
    7233             :   // We're not in an update, but it is not safe to run scripts, so
    7234             :   // postpone frameloader initialization and finalization.
    7235           1 :   if (!nsContentUtils::IsSafeToRunScript()) {
    7236           1 :     if (!mInDestructor && !mFrameLoaderRunner &&
    7237           1 :         (mInitializableFrameLoaders.Length() ||
    7238           1 :          mFrameLoaderFinalizers.Length())) {
    7239           0 :       mFrameLoaderRunner =
    7240           0 :         NewRunnableMethod(this, &nsDocument::MaybeInitializeFinalizeFrameLoaders);
    7241           0 :       nsContentUtils::AddScriptRunner(mFrameLoaderRunner);
    7242             :     }
    7243             :     return;
    7244             :   }
    7245           1 :   mFrameLoaderRunner = nullptr;
    7246             : 
    7247             :   // Don't use a temporary array for mInitializableFrameLoaders, because
    7248             :   // loading a frame may cause some other frameloader to be removed from the
    7249             :   // array. But be careful to keep the loader alive when starting the load!
    7250           1 :   while (mInitializableFrameLoaders.Length()) {
    7251           1 :     RefPtr<nsFrameLoader> loader = mInitializableFrameLoaders[0];
    7252           1 :     mInitializableFrameLoaders.RemoveElementAt(0);
    7253             :     NS_ASSERTION(loader, "null frameloader in the array?");
    7254           1 :     loader->ReallyStartLoading();
    7255           1 :   }
    7256             : 
    7257           1 :   uint32_t length = mFrameLoaderFinalizers.Length();
    7258           1 :   if (length > 0) {
    7259             :     nsTArray<nsCOMPtr<nsIRunnable> > finalizers;
    7260           1 :     mFrameLoaderFinalizers.SwapElements(finalizers);
    7261           1 :     for (uint32_t i = 0; i < length; ++i) {
    7262           1 :       finalizers[i]->Run();
    7263             :     }

    7719             : 
    7720             : nsViewportInfo
    7721           1 : nsDocument::GetViewportInfo(const ScreenIntSize& aDisplaySize)
    7722             : {
    7723             :   // Compute the CSS-to-LayoutDevice pixel scale as the product of the
    7724             :   // widget scale and the full zoom.
    7725           1 :   nsPresContext* context = mPresShell->GetPresContext();
    7726             :   // When querying the full zoom, get it from the device context rather than
    7727             :   // directly from the pres context, because the device context's value can
    7728             :   // include an adjustment necessay to keep the number of app units per device
    7729             :   // pixel an integer, and we want the adjusted value.
    7730           1 :   float fullZoom = context ? context->DeviceContext()->GetFullZoom() : 1.0;
    7731           1 :   fullZoom = (fullZoom == 0.0) ? 1.0 : fullZoom;
    7732           1 :   CSSToLayoutDeviceScale layoutDeviceScale = context ? context->CSSToDevPixelScale() : CSSToLayoutDeviceScale(1);
    7733             : 
    7734             :   CSSToScreenScale defaultScale = layoutDeviceScale
    7735             :                                 * LayoutDeviceToScreenScale(1.0);
    7736             : 
    7737             :   // Special behaviour for desktop mode, provided we are not on an about: page
    7738           1 :   nsPIDOMWindowOuter* win = GetWindow();
    7739           1 :   if (win && win->IsDesktopModeViewport() && !IsAboutPage())
    7740             :   {
    7741           0 :     CSSCoord viewportWidth = gfxPrefs::DesktopViewportWidth() / fullZoom;
    7742           0 :     CSSToScreenScale scaleToFit(aDisplaySize.width / viewportWidth);
    7743           0 :     float aspectRatio = (float)aDisplaySize.height / aDisplaySize.width;
    7744           0 :     CSSSize viewportSize(viewportWidth, viewportWidth * aspectRatio);
    7745           0 :     ScreenIntSize fakeDesktopSize = RoundedToInt(viewportSize * scaleToFit);
    7746             :     return nsViewportInfo(fakeDesktopSize,
    7747             :                           scaleToFit,
    7748           0 :                           /*allowZoom*/ true);
    7749             :   }
    7750             : 
    7751           1 :   if (!gfxPrefs::MetaViewportEnabled()) {
    7752             :     return nsViewportInfo(aDisplaySize,
    7753             :                           defaultScale,
    7754           1 :                           /*allowZoom*/ false);
    7755             :   }
    7756             : 
    7757             :   // In cases where the width of the CSS viewport is less than or equal to the width
    7758             :   // of the display (i.e. width <= device-width) then we disable double-tap-to-zoom
    7759             :   // behaviour. See bug 941995 for details.
    7760             : 
    7761           1 :   switch (mViewportType) {
    7762             :   case DisplayWidthHeight:
    7763             :     return nsViewportInfo(aDisplaySize,
    7764             :                           defaultScale,
    7765           0 :                           /*allowZoom*/ true);
    7766             :   case Unknown:
    7767             :   {
    7768           1 :     nsAutoString viewport;
    7769           1 :     GetHeaderData(nsGkAtoms::viewport, viewport);
    7770           1 :     if (viewport.IsEmpty()) {
    7771             :       // If the docType specifies that we are on a site optimized for mobile,
    7772             :       // then we want to return specially crafted defaults for the viewport info.
    7773             :       nsCOMPtr<nsIDOMDocumentType> docType;
    7774           1 :       nsresult rv = GetDoctype(getter_AddRefs(docType));
    7775           1 :       if (NS_SUCCEEDED(rv) && docType) {
    7776           0 :         nsAutoString docId;
    7777           0 :         rv = docType->GetPublicId(docId);
    7778           0 :         if (NS_SUCCEEDED(rv)) {
    7779           0 :           if ((docId.Find("WAP") != -1) ||
    7780           0 :               (docId.Find("Mobile") != -1) ||
    7781           0 :               (docId.Find("WML") != -1))
    7782             :           {
    7783             :             // We're making an assumption that the docType can't change here

    8035             : void
    8036           1 : nsDocument::FlushPendingNotifications(FlushType aType)
    8037             : {
    8038             :   nsDocumentOnStack dos(this);
    8039             : 
    8040             :   // We need to flush the sink for non-HTML documents (because the XML
    8041             :   // parser still does insertion with deferred notifications).  We
    8042             :   // also need to flush the sink if this is a layout-related flush, to
    8043             :   // make sure that layout is started as needed.  But we can skip that
    8044             :   // part if we have no presshell or if it's already done an initial
    8045             :   // reflow.
    8046           1 :   if ((!IsHTMLDocument() ||
    8047           1 :        (aType > FlushType::ContentAndNotify && mPresShell &&
    8048           1 :         !mPresShell->DidInitialize())) &&
    8049           1 :       (mParser || mWeakSink)) {
    8050             :     nsCOMPtr<nsIContentSink> sink;
    8051           1 :     if (mParser) {
    8052           1 :       sink = mParser->GetContentSink();
    8053             :     } else {
    8054           1 :       sink = do_QueryReferent(mWeakSink);
    8055           1 :       if (!sink) {
    8056           1 :         mWeakSink = nullptr;
    8057             :       }
    8058             :     }
    8059             :     // Determine if it is safe to flush the sink notifications
    8060             :     // by determining if it safe to flush all the presshells.
    8061           1 :     if (sink && (aType == FlushType::Content || IsSafeToFlush())) {
    8062           1 :       sink->FlushPendingNotifications(aType);
    8063             :     }
    8064             :   }
    8065             : 
    8066             :   // Should we be flushing pending binding constructors in here?
    8067             : 
    8068           1 :   if (aType <= FlushType::ContentAndNotify) {
    8069             :     // Nothing to do here
    8070           1 :     return;
    8071             :   }
    8072             : 
    8073             :   // If we have a parent we must flush the parent too to ensure that our
    8074             :   // container is reflowed if its size was changed.  But if it's not safe to
    8075             :   // flush ourselves, then don't flush the parent, since that can cause things
    8076             :   // like resizes of our frame's widget, which we can't handle while flushing
    8077             :   // is unsafe.
    8078             :   // Since media queries mean that a size change of our container can
    8079             :   // affect style, we need to promote a style flush on ourself to a
    8080             :   // layout flush on our parent, since we need our container to be the
    8081             :   // correct size to determine the correct style.
    8082           1 :   if (mParentDocument && IsSafeToFlush()) {
    8083           1 :     FlushType parentType = aType;
    8084           1 :     if (aType >= FlushType::Style)
    8085           1 :       parentType = std::max(FlushType::Layout, aType);
    8086           1 :     mParentDocument->FlushPendingNotifications(parentType);
    8087             :   }
    8088             : 
    8089           1 :   if (nsIPresShell* shell = GetShell()) {
    8090           1 :     shell->FlushPendingNotifications(aType);
    8091           1 :   }
    8092             : }

    8501             : void
    8502           1 : nsDocument::Sanitize()
    8503             : {
    8504             :   // Sanitize the document by resetting all password fields and any form
    8505             :   // fields with autocomplete=off to their default values.  We do this now,
    8506             :   // instead of when the presentation is restored, to offer some protection
    8507             :   // in case there is ever an exploit that allows a cached document to be
    8508             :   // accessed from a different document.
    8509             : 
    8510             :   // First locate all input elements, regardless of whether they are
    8511             :   // in a form, and reset the password and autocomplete=off elements.

    8513           1 :   RefPtr<nsContentList> nodes = GetElementsByTagName(NS_LITERAL_STRING("input"));

    8515           1 :   nsAutoString value;

    8518           1 :   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < length; ++i) {
    8519             :     NS_ASSERTION(nodes->Item(i), "null item in node list!");
    8520             : 
    8521           1 :     RefPtr<HTMLInputElement> input = HTMLInputElement::FromContentOrNull(nodes->Item(i));
    8522           1 :     if (!input)
    8523           0 :       continue;
    8524             : 
    8525           1 :     bool resetValue = false;
    8526             : 
    8527           1 :     input->GetAttribute(NS_LITERAL_STRING("autocomplete"), value);
    8528           1 :     if (value.LowerCaseEqualsLiteral("off")) {
    8529             :       resetValue = true;
    8530             :     } else {
    8531           1 :       input->GetType(value);
    8532           1 :       if (value.LowerCaseEqualsLiteral("password"))
    8533           1 :         resetValue = true;
    8534             :     }
    8535             : 
    8536           1 :     if (resetValue) {
    8537           1 :       input->Reset();
    8538             :     }
    8539           1 :   }
    8540             :

    8821             : void
    8822           1 : nsDocument::BlockOnload()
    8823             : {
    8824           1 :   if (mDisplayDocument) {
    8825           1 :     mDisplayDocument->BlockOnload();
    8826           1 :     return;
    8827             :   }
    8828             : 
    8829             :   // If mScriptGlobalObject is null, we shouldn't be messing with the loadgroup
    8830             :   // -- it's not ours.
    8831           1 :   if (mOnloadBlockCount == 0 && mScriptGlobalObject) {

    8850             : void
    8851           1 : nsDocument::UnblockOnload(bool aFireSync)

    8853           1 :   if (mDisplayDocument) {
    8854           1 :     mDisplayDocument->UnblockOnload(aFireSync);
    8855           1 :     return;
    8856             :   }

    8859             :     NS_NOTREACHED("More UnblockOnload() calls than BlockOnload() calls; dropping call");

    8861             :   }
    8862             :

    8867             :       // Only manipulate the loadgroup in this case, because if mScriptGlobalObject

    8874           1 :         PostUnblockOnloadEvent();
    8875             :       }
    8876           1 :     } else if (mIsBeingUsedAsImage) {
    8877             :       // To correctly unblock onload for a document that contains an SVG
    8878             :       // image, we need to know when all of the SVG document's resources are
    8879             :       // done loading, in a way comparable to |window.onload|. We fire this
    8880             :       // event to indicate that the SVG should be considered fully loaded.

    8904             : void
    8905           1 : nsDocument::PostUnblockOnloadEvent()

    8907           1 :   MOZ_RELEASE_ASSERT(NS_IsMainThread());

    8932             :     // post a new event when we unblock again.

    9162           1 :   ClearPendingFullscreenRequests(this);
    9163           1 :   if (GetFullscreenElement()) {
    9164             :     // If this document was fullscreen, we should exit fullscreen in this
    9165             :     // doctree branch. This ensures that if the user navigates while in
    9166             :     // fullscreen mode we don't leave its still visible ancestor documents
    9167             :     // in fullscreen mode. So exit fullscreen in the document's fullscreen
    9168             :     // root document, as this will exit fullscreen in all the root's
    9169             :     // descendant documents. Note that documents are removed from the
    9170             :     // doctree by the time OnPageHide() is called, so we must store a
    9171             :     // reference to the root (in nsDocument::mFullscreenRoot) since we can't
    9172             :     // just traverse the doctree to get the root.
    9173           1 :     nsIDocument::ExitFullscreenInDocTree(this);
    9174             : 
    9175             :     // Since the document is removed from the doctree before OnPageHide() is
    9176             :     // called, ExitFullscreen() can't traverse from the root down to *this*
    9177             :     // document, so we must manually call CleanupFullscreenState() below too.
    9178             :     // Note that CleanupFullscreenState() clears nsDocument::mFullscreenRoot,
    9179             :     // so we *must* call it after ExitFullscreen(), not before.
    9180             :     // OnPageHide() is called in every hidden (i.e. descendant) document,
    9181             :     // so calling CleanupFullscreenState() here will ensure all hidden
    9182             :     // documents have their fullscreen state reset.
    9183           1 :     CleanupFullscreenState();
    9184             : 
    9185             :     // If anyone was listening to this document's state, advertizing the state
    9186             :     // change would be the least of the politeness.
    9187           1 :     DispatchFullScreenChange(this);
    9188             :   }

    9313           1 : nsDocument::CloneDocHelper(nsDocument* clone) const

    9316             :

    9324             :     // |mDocumentContainer| is the container of the document that is being

   10626             : class UnblockParsingPromiseHandler final : public PromiseNativeHandler
   10627             : {
   10628             : public:
   10629             :   NS_DECL_CYCLE_COLLECTING_ISUPPORTS
   10630           1 :   NS_DECL_CYCLE_COLLECTION_CLASS(UnblockParsingPromiseHandler)
   10631             : 
   10632           1 :   explicit UnblockParsingPromiseHandler(nsIDocument* aDocument, Promise* aPromise)
   10633           1 :     : mPromise(aPromise)
   10634             :   {
   10635           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIParser> parser = aDocument->CreatorParserOrNull();
   10636           1 :     if (parser) {
   10637           1 :       parser->BlockParser();
   10638           1 :       mParser = do_GetWeakReference(parser);
   10639           1 :       mDocument = aDocument;
   10640             :     }
   10641           1 :   }
   10642             : 
   10643             :   void
   10644           1 :   ResolvedCallback(JSContext* aCx, JS::Handle<JS::Value> aValue) override
   10645             :   {
   10646           1 :     MaybeUnblockParser();

   10648           1 :     mPromise->MaybeResolve(aCx, aValue);

   10656           0 :     mPromise->MaybeReject(aCx, aValue);
   10657           0 :   }
   10658             : 
   10659             : protected:

   10662             :     // If we're being cleaned up by the cycle collector, our mDocument reference
   10663             :     // may have been unlinked while our mParser weak reference is still alive.
   10664           1 :     if (mDocument) {
   10665           0 :       MaybeUnblockParser();

   10668             :

   10671           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIParser> parser = do_QueryReferent(mParser);
   10672           1 :     if (parser) {
   10673           1 :       MOZ_DIAGNOSTIC_ASSERT(mDocument);

   10676           1 :         parser->UnblockParser();

   10678             :       }
   10679             :     }
   10680           1 :     mParser = nullptr;
   10681           1 :     mDocument = nullptr;
   10682           1 :   }

   10748             : 
   10749             : namespace mozilla {
   10750             : 
   10751             : // Singleton class to manage the list of fullscreen documents which are the
   10752             : // root of a branch which contains fullscreen documents. We maintain this list
   10753             : // so that we can easily exit all windows from fullscreen when the user
   10754             : // presses the escape key.
   10755             : class FullscreenRoots {
   10756             : public:
   10757             :   // Adds the root of given document to the manager. Calling this method
   10758             :   // with a document whose root is already contained has no effect.
   10759             :   static void Add(nsIDocument* aDoc);
   10760             : 
   10761             :   // Iterates over every root in the root list, and calls aFunction, passing
   10762             :   // each root once to aFunction. It is safe to call Add() and Remove() while
   10763             :   // iterating over the list (i.e. in aFunction). Documents that are removed
   10764             :   // from the manager during traversal are not traversed, and documents that
   10765             :   // are added to the manager during traversal are also not traversed.
   10766             :   static void ForEach(void(*aFunction)(nsIDocument* aDoc));
   10767             : 
   10768             :   // Removes the root of a specific document from the manager.
   10769             :   static void Remove(nsIDocument* aDoc);
   10770             : 
   10771             :   // Returns true if all roots added to the list have been removed.
   10772             :   static bool IsEmpty();
   10773             : 
   10774             : private:
   10775             : 
   10776           1 :   FullscreenRoots() {
   10777             :     MOZ_COUNT_CTOR(FullscreenRoots);
   10778             :   }
   10779           1 :   ~FullscreenRoots() {
   10780             :     MOZ_COUNT_DTOR(FullscreenRoots);
   10781           1 :   }
   10782             : 
   10783             :   enum {
   10784             :     NotFound = uint32_t(-1)
   10785             :   };
   10786             :   // Looks in mRoots for aRoot. Returns the index if found, otherwise NotFound.
   10787             :   static uint32_t Find(nsIDocument* aRoot);
   10788             : 
   10789             :   // Returns true if aRoot is in the list of fullscreen roots.
   10790             :   static bool Contains(nsIDocument* aRoot);
   10791             : 
   10792             :   // Singleton instance of the FullscreenRoots. This is instantiated when a
   10793             :   // root is added, and it is deleted when the last root is removed.
   10794             :   static FullscreenRoots* sInstance;
   10795             : 
   10796             :   // List of weak pointers to roots.
   10797             :   nsTArray<nsWeakPtr> mRoots;
   10798             : };
   10799             : 
   10800             : FullscreenRoots* FullscreenRoots::sInstance = nullptr;
   10801             : 
   10802             : /* static */
   10803             : void
   10804           1 : FullscreenRoots::ForEach(void(*aFunction)(nsIDocument* aDoc))
   10805             : {
   10806           1 :   if (!sInstance) {
   10807           0 :     return;
   10808             :   }
   10809             :   // Create a copy of the roots array, and iterate over the copy. This is so
   10810             :   // that if an element is removed from mRoots we don't mess up our iteration.
   10811           1 :   nsTArray<nsWeakPtr> roots(sInstance->mRoots);
   10812             :   // Call aFunction on all entries.
   10813           1 :   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < roots.Length(); i++) {
   10814           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> root = do_QueryReferent(roots[i]);
   10815             :     // Check that the root isn't in the manager. This is so that new additions
   10816             :     // while we were running don't get traversed.
   10817           1 :     if (root && FullscreenRoots::Contains(root)) {
   10818           1 :       aFunction(root);
   10819             :     }
   10820             :   }
   10821             : }
   10822             : 
   10823             : /* static */
   10824             : bool
   10825           1 : FullscreenRoots::Contains(nsIDocument* aRoot)
   10826             : {
   10827           1 :   return FullscreenRoots::Find(aRoot) != NotFound;
   10828             : }
   10829             : 
   10830             : /* static */
   10831             : void
   10832           1 : FullscreenRoots::Add(nsIDocument* aDoc)
   10833             : {
   10834           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> root = nsContentUtils::GetRootDocument(aDoc);
   10835           1 :   if (!FullscreenRoots::Contains(root)) {
   10836           1 :     if (!sInstance) {
   10837           1 :       sInstance = new FullscreenRoots();
   10838             :     }
   10839           1 :     sInstance->mRoots.AppendElement(do_GetWeakReference(root));
   10840             :   }
   10841           1 : }
   10842             : 
   10843             : /* static */
   10844             : uint32_t
   10845           1 : FullscreenRoots::Find(nsIDocument* aRoot)
   10846             : {
   10847           1 :   if (!sInstance) {
   10848             :     return NotFound;
   10849             :   }
   10850             :   nsTArray<nsWeakPtr>& roots = sInstance->mRoots;
   10851           1 :   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < roots.Length(); i++) {
   10852           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> otherRoot(do_QueryReferent(roots[i]));
   10853           1 :     if (otherRoot == aRoot) {
   10854           1 :       return i;
   10855             :     }
   10856             :   }
   10857             :   return NotFound;
   10858             : }
   10859             : 
   10860             : /* static */
   10861             : void
   10862           1 : FullscreenRoots::Remove(nsIDocument* aDoc)
   10863             : {
   10864           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> root = nsContentUtils::GetRootDocument(aDoc);
   10865           1 :   uint32_t index = Find(root);
   10866             :   NS_ASSERTION(index != NotFound,
   10867             :     "Should only try to remove roots which are still added!");
   10868           1 :   if (index == NotFound || !sInstance) {
   10869           1 :     return;
   10870             :   }
   10871           1 :   sInstance->mRoots.RemoveElementAt(index);
   10872           1 :   if (sInstance->mRoots.IsEmpty()) {
   10873           1 :     delete sInstance;
   10874           1 :     sInstance = nullptr;
   10875             :   }
   10876             : }
   10877             : 
   10878             : /* static */
   10879             : bool
   10880           0 : FullscreenRoots::IsEmpty()
   10881             : {
   10882           1 :   return !sInstance;
   10883             : }
   10884             : 
   10885             : } // end namespace mozilla.
   10886             : using mozilla::FullscreenRoots;
   10887             : 
   10888             : nsIDocument*
   10889           1 : nsDocument::GetFullscreenRoot()
   10890             : {
   10891           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> root = do_QueryReferent(mFullscreenRoot);
   10892           1 :   return root;
   10893             : }
   10894             : 
   10895             : void
   10896           1 : nsDocument::SetFullscreenRoot(nsIDocument* aRoot)
   10897             : {
   10898           1 :   mFullscreenRoot = do_GetWeakReference(aRoot);
   10899           1 : }
   10900             : 
   10901             : void
   10902           1 : nsIDocument::ExitFullscreen()

   10999             : // Since nsIDocument::ExitFullscreenInDocTree() could be called from
   11000             : // Element::UnbindFromTree() where it is not safe to synchronously run

   11003             : {
   11004             : public:
   11005           1 :   explicit ExitFullscreenScriptRunnable(nsCOMArray<nsIDocument>&& aDocuments)

   11008           1 :   NS_IMETHOD Run() override
   11009             :   {
   11010             :     // Dispatch MozDOMFullscreen:Exited to the last document in

   11029             : /* static */ void
   11030           1 : nsIDocument::ExitFullscreenInDocTree(nsIDocument* aMaybeNotARootDoc)
   11031             : {
   11032             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aMaybeNotARootDoc);
   11033             : 
   11034             :   // Unlock the pointer
   11035             :   UnlockPointer();
   11036             : 
   11037           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> root = aMaybeNotARootDoc->GetFullscreenRoot();
   11038           1 :   if (!root || !root->GetFullscreenElement()) {
   11039             :     // If a document was detached before exiting from fullscreen, it is
   11040             :     // possible that the root had left fullscreen state. In this case,
   11041             :     // we would not get anything from the ResetFullScreen() call. Root's
   11042             :     // not being a fullscreen doc also means the widget should have
   11043             :     // exited fullscreen state. It means even if we do not return here,
   11044             :     // we would actually do nothing below except crashing ourselves via
   11045             :     // dispatching the "MozDOMFullscreen:Exited" event to an nonexistent
   11046             :     // document.
   11047           1 :     return;
   11048             :   }
   11049             : 
   11050             :   // Stores a list of documents to which we must dispatch "fullscreenchange".
   11051             :   // We're required by the spec to dispatch the events in leaf-to-root
   11052             :   // order when exiting fullscreen, but we traverse the doctree in a
   11053             :   // root-to-leaf order, so we save references to the documents we must
   11054             :   // dispatch to so that we dispatch in the specified order.
   11055             :   nsCOMArray<nsIDocument> changed;
   11056             : 
   11057             :   // Walk the tree of fullscreen documents, and reset their fullscreen state.
   11058           1 :   ResetFullScreen(root, static_cast<void*>(&changed));
   11059             : 
   11060             :   // Dispatch "fullscreenchange" events. Note this loop is in reverse
   11061             :   // order so that the events for the leaf document arrives before the root
   11062             :   // document, as required by the spec.
   11063           1 :   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < changed.Length(); ++i) {
   11064           1 :     DispatchFullScreenChange(changed[changed.Length() - i - 1]);
   11065             :   }
   11066             : 
   11067             :   NS_ASSERTION(!root->GetFullscreenElement(),
   11068             :     "Fullscreen root should no longer be a fullscreen doc...");
   11069             : 
   11070             :   // Move the top-level window out of fullscreen mode.
   11071           1 :   FullscreenRoots::Remove(root);
   11072             : 
   11073             :   nsContentUtils::AddScriptRunner(
   11074           1 :     new ExitFullscreenScriptRunnable(Move(changed)));
   11075             : }
   11076             : 
   11077             : bool
   11078           1 : GetFullscreenLeaf(nsIDocument* aDoc, void* aData)
   11079             : {
   11080           1 :   if (aDoc->IsFullscreenLeaf()) {

   11083           1 :     return false;

   11091           1 : GetFullscreenLeaf(nsIDocument* aDoc)

   11096             :     return leaf;
   11097             :   }

   11099             :   // below the fullscreen doc. Start the search from the root.
   11100           1 :   nsIDocument* root = nsContentUtils::GetRootDocument(aDoc);

   11102             :   // around its descendants.

   11104             :     return nullptr;

   11110             : void
   11111           1 : nsDocument::RestorePreviousFullScreenState()
   11112             : {
   11113             :   NS_ASSERTION(!GetFullscreenElement() || !FullscreenRoots::IsEmpty(),
   11114             :     "Should have at least 1 fullscreen root when fullscreen!");
   11115             : 
   11116           1 :   if (!GetFullscreenElement() || !GetWindow() || FullscreenRoots::IsEmpty()) {
   11117           1 :     return;
   11118             :   }

   11120           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> fullScreenDoc = GetFullscreenLeaf(this);
   11121           1 :   AutoTArray<nsDocument*, 8> exitDocs;
   11122             : 
   11123           1 :   nsIDocument* doc = fullScreenDoc;
   11124             :   // Collect all subdocuments.
   11125           1 :   for (; doc != this; doc = doc->GetParentDocument()) {
   11126           1 :     exitDocs.AppendElement(static_cast<nsDocument*>(doc));
   11127             :   }
   11128             :   MOZ_ASSERT(doc == this, "Must have reached this doc");
   11129             :   // Collect all ancestor documents which we are going to change.
   11130           1 :   for (; doc; doc = doc->GetParentDocument()) {
   11131           1 :     nsDocument* theDoc = static_cast<nsDocument*>(doc);
   11132             :     MOZ_ASSERT(!theDoc->mFullScreenStack.IsEmpty(),
   11133             :                "Ancestor of fullscreen document must also be in fullscreen");

   11139             :           // fullscreen, don't rollback it automatically.
   11140             :           break;
   11141             :         }
   11142             :       }

   11144           1 :     exitDocs.AppendElement(theDoc);
   11145           1 :     if (theDoc->mFullScreenStack.Length() > 1) {
   11146             :       break;
   11147             :     }
   11148             :   }
   11149             : 
   11150           1 :   nsDocument* lastDoc = exitDocs.LastElement();

   11152           1 :       lastDoc->mFullScreenStack.Length() == 1) {
   11153             :     // If we are fully exiting fullscreen, don't touch anything here,
   11154             :     // just wait for the window to get out from fullscreen first.
   11155           1 :     AskWindowToExitFullscreen(this);
   11156             :     return;
   11157             :   }
   11158             : 
   11159             :   // If fullscreen mode is updated the pointer should be unlocked
   11160           1 :   UnlockPointer();
   11161             :   // All documents listed in the array except the last one are going to
   11162             :   // completely exit from the fullscreen state.
   11163           1 :   for (auto i : IntegerRange(exitDocs.Length() - 1)) {
   11164           1 :     exitDocs[i]->CleanupFullscreenState();
   11165             :   }
   11166             :   // The last document will either rollback one fullscreen element, or
   11167             :   // completely exit from the fullscreen state as well.
   11168             :   nsIDocument* newFullscreenDoc;

   11170           1 :     lastDoc->FullScreenStackPop();

   11173           1 :     lastDoc->CleanupFullscreenState();
   11174           1 :     newFullscreenDoc = lastDoc->GetParentDocument();
   11175             :   }
   11176             :   // Dispatch the fullscreenchange event to all document listed.
   11177           1 :   for (nsDocument* d : exitDocs) {
   11178           1 :     DispatchFullScreenChange(d);
   11179             :   }
   11180             : 
   11181             :   MOZ_ASSERT(newFullscreenDoc, "If we were going to exit from fullscreen on "
   11182             :              "all documents in this doctree, we should've asked the window to "
   11183             :              "exit first instead of reaching here.");
   11184           1 :   if (fullScreenDoc != newFullscreenDoc &&
   11185           1 :       !nsContentUtils::HaveEqualPrincipals(fullScreenDoc, newFullscreenDoc)) {

   11262             : void
   11263           1 : nsDocument::CleanupFullscreenState()
   11264             : {
   11265             :   // Iterate the fullscreen stack and clear the fullscreen states.
   11266             :   // Since we also need to clear the fullscreen-ancestor state, and
   11267             :   // currently fullscreen elements can only be placed in hierarchy
   11268             :   // order in the stack, reversely iterating the stack could be more
   11269             :   // efficient. NOTE that fullscreen-ancestor state would be removed
   11270             :   // in bug 1199529, and the elements may not in hierarchy order
   11271             :   // after bug 1195213.
   11272           1 :   for (nsWeakPtr& weakPtr : Reversed(mFullScreenStack)) {
   11273           1 :     if (nsCOMPtr<Element> element = do_QueryReferent(weakPtr)) {
   11274           1 :       ClearFullscreenStateOnElement(element);
   11275             :     }
   11276             :   }
   11277           1 :   mFullScreenStack.Clear();
   11278           1 :   mFullscreenRoot = nullptr;
   11279           1 :   UpdateViewportScrollbarOverrideForFullscreen(this);
   11280           1 : }
   11281             : 
   11282             : bool
   11283           1 : nsDocument::FullScreenStackPush(Element* aElement)
   11284             : {
   11285             :   NS_ASSERTION(aElement, "Must pass non-null to FullScreenStackPush()");

   11297             : void
   11298           1 : nsDocument::FullScreenStackPop()
   11299             : {
   11300           1 :   if (mFullScreenStack.IsEmpty()) {
   11301           1 :     return;
   11302             :   }
   11303             : 
   11304           1 :   ClearFullscreenStateOnElement(FullScreenStackTop());
   11305             : 
   11306             :   // Remove top element. Note the remaining top element in the stack
   11307             :   // will not have full-screen style bits set, so we will need to restore
   11308             :   // them on the new top element before returning.
   11309           1 :   uint32_t last = mFullScreenStack.Length() - 1;
   11310           1 :   mFullScreenStack.RemoveElementAt(last);
   11311             : 
   11312             :   // Pop from the stack null elements (references to elements which have
   11313             :   // been GC'd since they were added to the stack) and elements which are
   11314             :   // no longer in this document.

   11358             : // Returns true if aDoc is in the focused tab in the active window.
   11359             : static bool
   11360           1 : IsInActiveTab(nsIDocument* aDoc)
   11361             : {
   11362           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShell> docshell = aDoc->GetDocShell();
   11363           1 :   if (!docshell) {
   11364             :     return false;
   11365             :   }
   11366             : 
   11367           1 :   bool isActive = false;
   11368           1 :   docshell->GetIsActive(&isActive);
   11369           1 :   if (!isActive) {
   11370             :     return false;
   11371             :   }
   11372             : 
   11373             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShellTreeItem> rootItem;
   11374           1 :   docshell->GetRootTreeItem(getter_AddRefs(rootItem));
   11375           1 :   if (!rootItem) {
   11376             :     return false;
   11377             :   }

   11379           1 :   if (!rootWin) {
   11380             :     return false;

   11392             :   }
   11393             : 
   11394           1 :   return activeWindow == rootWin;
   11395             : }
   11396             : 
   11397           0 : nsresult nsDocument::RemoteFrameFullscreenChanged(nsIDOMElement* aFrameElement)
   11398             : {
   11399             :   // Ensure the frame element is the fullscreen element in this document.
   11400             :   // If the frame element is already the fullscreen element in this document,
   11401             :   // this has no effect.
   11402           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIContent> content(do_QueryInterface(aFrameElement));
   11403           0 :   auto request = MakeUnique<FullscreenRequest>(content->AsElement());
   11404           0 :   request->mIsCallerChrome = false;
   11405           0 :   request->mShouldNotifyNewOrigin = false;
   11406           0 :   RequestFullScreen(Move(request));
   11407             : 
   11408           0 :   return NS_OK;

   11532             : 
   11533             : // Any fullscreen request waiting for the widget to finish being full-
   11534             : // screen is queued here. This is declared static instead of a member
   11535             : // of nsDocument because in the majority of time, there would be at most
   11536             : // one document requesting fullscreen. We shouldn't waste the space to
   11537             : // hold for it in every document.
   11538             : class PendingFullscreenRequestList
   11539             : {
   11540             : public:
   11541           1 :   static void Add(UniquePtr<FullscreenRequest>&& aRequest)
   11542             :   {
   11543           1 :     sList.insertBack(aRequest.release());
   11544           1 :   }
   11545             : 
   11546             :   static const FullscreenRequest* GetLast()
   11547             :   {
   11548             :     return sList.getLast();
   11549             :   }
   11550             : 
   11551             :   enum IteratorOption
   11552             :   {
   11553             :     // When we are committing fullscreen changes or preparing for
   11554             :     // that, we generally want to iterate all requests in the same
   11555             :     // window with eDocumentsWithSameRoot option.
   11556             :     eDocumentsWithSameRoot,
   11557             :     // If we are removing a document from the tree, we would only
   11558             :     // want to remove the requests from the given document and its
   11559             :     // descendants. For that case, use eInclusiveDescendants.
   11560             :     eInclusiveDescendants
   11561             :   };
   11562             : 
   11563           1 :   class Iterator
   11564             :   {
   11565             :   public:
   11566           1 :     explicit Iterator(nsIDocument* aDoc, IteratorOption aOption)
   11567           1 :       : mCurrent(PendingFullscreenRequestList::sList.getFirst())
   11568           1 :       , mRootShellForIteration(aDoc->GetDocShell())
   11569             :     {
   11570           1 :       if (mCurrent) {
   11571           1 :         if (mRootShellForIteration && aOption == eDocumentsWithSameRoot) {
   11572           1 :           mRootShellForIteration->
   11573           1 :             GetRootTreeItem(getter_AddRefs(mRootShellForIteration));
   11574             :         }
   11575           1 :         SkipToNextMatch();
   11576             :       }
   11577           1 :     }
   11578             : 
   11579           1 :     void DeleteAndNext()
   11580             :     {
   11581           1 :       DeleteAndNextInternal();
   11582           1 :       SkipToNextMatch();
   11583           1 :     }
   11584             :     bool AtEnd() const { return mCurrent == nullptr; }
   11585             :     const FullscreenRequest& Get() const { return *mCurrent; }
   11586             : 
   11587             :   private:
   11588           1 :     void DeleteAndNextInternal()
   11589             :     {
   11590           1 :       FullscreenRequest* thisRequest = mCurrent;
   11591           1 :       mCurrent = mCurrent->getNext();
   11592           1 :       delete thisRequest;
   11593           1 :     }
   11594           1 :     void SkipToNextMatch()
   11595             :     {
   11596           1 :       while (mCurrent) {
   11597             :         nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShellTreeItem>
   11598           1 :           docShell = mCurrent->GetDocument()->GetDocShell();
   11599           1 :         if (!docShell) {
   11600             :           // Always automatically drop documents which has been
   11601             :           // detached from the doc shell.
   11602           0 :           DeleteAndNextInternal();
   11603             :         } else {
   11604           1 :           while (docShell && docShell != mRootShellForIteration) {
   11605           1 :             docShell->GetParent(getter_AddRefs(docShell));
   11606             :           }
   11607           1 :           if (!docShell) {
   11608             :             // We've gone over the root, but haven't find the target
   11609             :             // ancestor, so skip this item.
   11610           0 :             mCurrent = mCurrent->getNext();
   11611             :           } else {
   11612             :             break;
   11613             :           }
   11614             :         }
   11615             :       }
   11616           1 :     }
   11617             : 
   11618             :     FullscreenRequest* mCurrent;
   11619             :     nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShellTreeItem> mRootShellForIteration;

   11642             : static bool
   11643           1 : ShouldApplyFullscreenDirectly(nsIDocument* aDoc,
   11644             :                               nsPIDOMWindowOuter* aRootWin)
   11645             : {
   11646           1 :   if (XRE_GetProcessType() == GeckoProcessType_Content) {
   11647             :     // If we are in the content process, we can apply the fullscreen
   11648             :     // state directly only if we have been in DOM fullscreen, because
   11649             :     // otherwise we always need to notify the chrome.
   11650           0 :     return !!nsContentUtils::GetRootDocument(aDoc)->GetFullscreenElement();

   11652             :     // If we are in the chrome process, and the window has not been in
   11653             :     // fullscreen, we certainly need to make that fullscreen first.
   11654           1 :     if (!aRootWin->GetFullScreen()) {
   11655             :       return false;
   11656             :     }

   11658             :     // pending fullscreen request relates to this document. We have to
   11659             :     // push the request to the pending queue so requests are handled
   11660             :     // in the correct order.

   11662           1 :       iter(aDoc, PendingFullscreenRequestList::eDocumentsWithSameRoot);
   11663           1 :     if (!iter.AtEnd()) {
   11664             :       return false;
   11665             :     }
   11666             :     // We have to apply the fullscreen state directly in this case,
   11667             :     // because nsGlobalWindow::SetFullscreenInternal() will do nothing
   11668             :     // if it is already in fullscreen. If we do not apply the state but
   11669             :     // instead add it to the queue and wait for the window as normal,
   11670             :     // we would get stuck.
   11671           1 :     return true;
   11672             :   }

   11727             :     }
   11728           1 :     iter.DeleteAndNext();

   11743             : bool
   11744           1 : nsDocument::ApplyFullscreen(const FullscreenRequest& aRequest)
   11745             : {
   11746           1 :   Element* elem = aRequest.GetElement();
   11747           1 :   if (!FullscreenElementReadyCheck(elem, aRequest.mIsCallerChrome)) {
   11748             :     return false;
   11749             :   }
   11750             : 
   11751             :   // Stash a reference to any existing fullscreen doc, we'll use this later
   11752             :   // to detect if the origin which is fullscreen has changed.
   11753           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> previousFullscreenDoc = GetFullscreenLeaf(this);
   11754             : 
   11755             :   // Stores a list of documents which we must dispatch "fullscreenchange"
   11756             :   // too. We're required by the spec to dispatch the events in root-to-leaf
   11757             :   // order, but we traverse the doctree in a leaf-to-root order, so we save
   11758             :   // references to the documents we must dispatch to so that we get the order
   11759             :   // as specified.
   11760           1 :   AutoTArray<nsIDocument*, 8> changed;
   11761             : 
   11762             :   // Remember the root document, so that if a full-screen document is hidden
   11763             :   // we can reset full-screen state in the remaining visible full-screen documents.
   11764           1 :   nsIDocument* fullScreenRootDoc = nsContentUtils::GetRootDocument(this);
   11765             : 
   11766             :   // If a document is already in fullscreen, then unlock the mouse pointer
   11767             :   // before setting a new document to fullscreen
   11768           1 :   UnlockPointer();
   11769             : 
   11770             :   // Set the full-screen element. This sets the full-screen style on the
   11771             :   // element, and the full-screen-ancestor styles on ancestors of the element
   11772             :   // in this document.
   11773           1 :   DebugOnly<bool> x = FullScreenStackPush(elem);
   11774             :   NS_ASSERTION(x, "Full-screen state of requesting doc should always change!");
   11775             :   // Set the iframe fullscreen flag.
   11776           1 :   if (elem->IsHTMLElement(nsGkAtoms::iframe)) {
   11777             :     static_cast<HTMLIFrameElement*>(elem)->SetFullscreenFlag(true);
   11778             :   }
   11779           1 :   changed.AppendElement(this);
   11780             : 
   11781             :   // Propagate up the document hierarchy, setting the full-screen element as
   11782             :   // the element's container in ancestor documents. This also sets the
   11783             :   // appropriate css styles as well. Note we don't propagate down the
   11784             :   // document hierarchy, the full-screen element (or its container) is not
   11785             :   // visible there. Stop when we reach the root document.
   11786           1 :   nsIDocument* child = this;
   11787             :   while (true) {
   11788           1 :     child->SetFullscreenRoot(fullScreenRootDoc);
   11789             :     NS_ASSERTION(child->GetFullscreenRoot() == fullScreenRootDoc,
   11790             :         "Fullscreen root should be set!");
   11791           1 :     if (child == fullScreenRootDoc) {
   11792             :       break;
   11793             :     }
   11794           1 :     nsIDocument* parent = child->GetParentDocument();
   11795           1 :     Element* element = parent->FindContentForSubDocument(child)->AsElement();
   11796           1 :     if (static_cast<nsDocument*>(parent)->FullScreenStackPush(element)) {
   11797           1 :       changed.AppendElement(parent);
   11798           1 :       child = parent;
   11799             :     } else {
   11800             :       // We've reached either the root, or a point in the doctree where the
   11801             :       // new full-screen element container is the same as the previous
   11802             :       // full-screen element's container. No more changes need to be made
   11803             :       // to the full-screen stacks of documents further up the tree.
   11804             :       break;
   11805             :     }
   11806             :   }
   11807             : 
   11808           1 :   FullscreenRoots::Add(this);
   11809             : 
   11810             :   // If it is the first entry of the fullscreen, trigger an event so
   11811             :   // that the UI can response to this change, e.g. hide chrome, or
   11812             :   // notifying parent process to enter fullscreen. Note that chrome
   11813             :   // code may also want to listen to MozDOMFullscreen:NewOrigin event
   11814             :   // to pop up warning UI.
   11815           1 :   if (!previousFullscreenDoc) {
   11816             :     nsContentUtils::DispatchEventOnlyToChrome(
   11817             :       this, ToSupports(elem), NS_LITERAL_STRING("MozDOMFullscreen:Entered"),
   11818           1 :       /* Bubbles */ true, /* Cancelable */ false, /* DefaultAction */ nullptr);
   11819             :   }
   11820             : 
   11821             :   // The origin which is fullscreen gets changed. Trigger an event so
   11822             :   // that the chrome knows to pop up a warning UI. Note that
   11823             :   // previousFullscreenDoc == nullptr upon first entry, so we always
   11824             :   // take this path on the first entry. Also note that, in a multi-
   11825             :   // process browser, the code in content process is responsible for
   11826             :   // sending message with the origin to its parent, and the parent
   11827             :   // shouldn't rely on this event itself.
   11828           1 :   if (aRequest.mShouldNotifyNewOrigin &&
   11829           1 :       !nsContentUtils::HaveEqualPrincipals(previousFullscreenDoc, this)) {
   11830             :     DispatchCustomEventWithFlush(
   11831             :       this, NS_LITERAL_STRING("MozDOMFullscreen:NewOrigin"),
   11832           1 :       /* Bubbles */ true, /* ChromeOnly */ true);
   11833             :   }
   11834             : 
   11835             :   // Dispatch "fullscreenchange" events. Note this loop is in reverse
   11836             :   // order so that the events for the root document arrives before the leaf
   11837             :   // document, as required by the spec.
   11838           1 :   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < changed.Length(); ++i) {
   11839           1 :     DispatchFullScreenChange(changed[changed.Length() - i - 1]);

   11926           1 : class PointerLockRequest final : public Runnable
   11927             : {
   11928             : public:
   11929           1 :   PointerLockRequest(Element* aElement, bool aUserInputOrChromeCaller)

   11996             : static void
   11997           1 : ChangePointerLockedElement(Element* aElement, nsIDocument* aDocument,

   12252             : VisibilityState
   12253           1 : nsDocument::GetVisibilityState() const
   12254             : {
   12255             :   // We have to check a few pieces of information here:
   12256             :   // 1)  Are we in bfcache (!IsVisible())?  If so, nothing else matters.
   12257             :   // 2)  Do we have an outer window?  If not, we're hidden.  Note that we don't
   12258             :   //     want to use GetWindow here because it does weird groveling for windows
   12259             :   //     in some cases.
   12260             :   // 3)  Is our outer window background?  If so, we're hidden.
   12261             :   // Otherwise, we're visible.
   12262           1 :   if (!IsVisible() || !mWindow || !mWindow->GetOuterWindow() ||
   12263           1 :       mWindow->GetOuterWindow()->IsBackground()) {
   12264             : 
   12265             :     // Check if the document is in prerender state.
   12266           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShell> docshell = GetDocShell();
   12267           1 :     if (docshell && docshell->GetIsPrerendered()) {
   12268             :       return dom::VisibilityState::Prerender;
   12269             :     }
   12270             : 
   12271           1 :     return dom::VisibilityState::Hidden;
   12272             :   }
   12273             : 
   12274             :   return dom::VisibilityState::Visible;
   12275             : }

   12377           1 : nsDocument::DocAddSizeOfExcludingThis(nsWindowSizes* aWindowSizes) const

   12666           0 : ReportExternalResourceUseCounters(nsIDocument* aDocument, void* aData)
   12667             : {

   12674             : void
   12675           1 : nsDocument::ReportUseCounters(UseCounterReportKind aKind)
   12676             : {
   12677             :   static const bool sDebugUseCounters = false;
   12678           1 :   if (mReportedUseCounters) {
   12679             :     return;
   12680             :   }
   12681             : 
   12682           1 :   mReportedUseCounters = true;
   12683             : 
   12684           1 :   if (aKind == UseCounterReportKind::eIncludeExternalResources) {
   12685           1 :     EnumerateExternalResources(ReportExternalResourceUseCounters, nullptr);
   12686             :   }
   12687             : 
   12688           1 :   if (Telemetry::HistogramUseCounterCount > 0 &&
   12689           1 :       (IsContentDocument() || IsResourceDoc())) {
   12690             :     nsCOMPtr<nsIURI> uri;
   12691           1 :     NodePrincipal()->GetURI(getter_AddRefs(uri));
   12692           1 :     if (!uri || MightBeAboutOrChromeScheme(uri)) {
   12693             :       return;
   12694             :     }
   12695             : 
   12696             :     if (sDebugUseCounters) {
   12697             :       nsCString spec = uri->GetSpecOrDefault();
   12698             : 
   12699             :       // URIs can be rather long for data documents, so truncate them to
   12700             :       // some reasonable length.
   12701             :       spec.Truncate(std::min(128U, spec.Length()));
   12702             :       printf("-- Use counters for %s --\n", spec.get());
   12703             :     }
   12704             : 
   12705             :     // We keep separate counts for individual documents and top-level
   12706             :     // pages to more accurately track how many web pages might break if
   12707             :     // certain features were removed.  Consider the case of a single
   12708             :     // HTML document with several SVG images and/or iframes with
   12709             :     // sub-documents of their own.  If we maintained a single set of use
   12710             :     // counters and all the sub-documents use a particular feature, then
   12711             :     // telemetry would indicate that we would be breaking N documents if
   12712             :     // that feature were removed.  Whereas with a document/top-level
   12713             :     // page split, we can see that N documents would be affected, but
   12714             :     // only a single web page would be affected.
   12715             : 
   12716             :     // The difference between the values of these two histograms and the
   12717             :     // related use counters below tell us how many pages did *not* use
   12718             :     // the feature in question.  For instance, if we see that a given
   12719             :     // session has destroyed 30 content documents, but a particular use
   12720             :     // counter shows only a count of 5, we can infer that the use
   12721             :     // counter was *not* used in 25 of those 30 documents.
   12722             :     //
   12723             :     // We do things this way, rather than accumulating a boolean flag
   12724             :     // for each use counter, to avoid sending histograms for features
   12725             :     // that don't get widely used.  Doing things in this fashion means
   12726             :     // smaller telemetry payloads and faster processing on the server
   12727             :     // side.
   12728           1 :     Telemetry::Accumulate(Telemetry::CONTENT_DOCUMENTS_DESTROYED, 1);
   12729           1 :     if (IsTopLevelContentDocument()) {
   12730           1 :       Telemetry::Accumulate(Telemetry::TOP_LEVEL_CONTENT_DOCUMENTS_DESTROYED, 1);
   12731             :     }
   12732             : 
   12733           1 :     for (int32_t c = 0;
   12734             :          c < eUseCounter_Count; ++c) {
   12735           1 :       UseCounter uc = static_cast<UseCounter>(c);
   12736             : 
   12737             :       Telemetry::HistogramID id =
   12738           1 :         static_cast<Telemetry::HistogramID>(Telemetry::HistogramFirstUseCounter + uc * 2);
   12739           1 :       bool value = GetUseCounter(uc);
   12740             : 
   12741           1 :       if (value) {
   12742             :         if (sDebugUseCounters) {
   12743             :           const char* name = Telemetry::GetHistogramName(id);
   12744             :           if (name) {
   12745             :             printf("  %s", name);
   12746             :           } else {
   12747             :             printf("  #%d", id);
   12748             :           }
   12749             :           printf(": %d\n", value);
   12750             :         }
   12751             : 
   12752           1 :         Telemetry::Accumulate(id, 1);
   12753             :       }
   12754             : 
   12755           1 :       if (IsTopLevelContentDocument()) {
   12756             :         id = static_cast<Telemetry::HistogramID>(Telemetry::HistogramFirstUseCounter +
   12757           1 :                                                  uc * 2 + 1);
   12758           1 :         value = GetUseCounter(uc) || GetChildDocumentUseCounter(uc);
   12759             : 
   12760           1 :         if (value) {
   12761             :           if (sDebugUseCounters) {
   12762             :             const char* name = Telemetry::GetHistogramName(id);
   12763             :             if (name) {
   12764             :               printf("  %s", name);
   12765             :             } else {
   12766             :               printf("  #%d", id);
   12767             :             }
   12768             :             printf(": %d\n", value);
   12769             :           }
   12770             : 
   12771           1 :           Telemetry::Accumulate(id, 1);
   12772             :         }
   12773             :       }
   12774             :     }
   12775             :   }
   12776             : }
   12777             :

   12999             : gfxUserFontSet*
   13000           1 : nsIDocument::GetUserFontSet(bool aFlushUserFontSet)
   13001             : {
   13002             :   // We want to initialize the user font set lazily the first time the
   13003             :   // user asks for it, rather than building it too early and forcing
   13004             :   // rule cascade creation.  Thus we try to enforce the invariant that
   13005             :   // we *never* build the user font set until the first call to
   13006             :   // GetUserFontSet.  However, once it's been requested, we can't wait
   13007             :   // for somebody to call GetUserFontSet in order to rebuild it (see
   13008             :   // comments below in RebuildUserFontSet for why).
   13009             : #ifdef DEBUG
   13010             :   bool userFontSetGottenBefore = mGetUserFontSetCalled;
   13011             : #endif
   13012             :   // Set mGetUserFontSetCalled up front, so that FlushUserFontSet will actually
   13013             :   // flush.
   13014           1 :   mGetUserFontSetCalled = true;
   13015           1 :   if (mFontFaceSetDirty && aFlushUserFontSet) {
   13016             :     // If this assertion fails, and there have actually been changes to
   13017             :     // @font-face rules, then we will call StyleChangeReflow in
   13018             :     // FlushUserFontSet.  If we're in the middle of reflow,
   13019             :     // that's a bad thing to do, and the caller was responsible for
   13020             :     // flushing first.  If we're not (e.g., in frame construction), it's
   13021             :     // ok.
   13022             :     NS_ASSERTION(!userFontSetGottenBefore ||
   13023             :                  !GetShell() ||
   13024             :                  !GetShell()->IsReflowLocked(),
   13025             :                  "FlushUserFontSet should have been called first");
   13026           1 :     FlushUserFontSet();
   13027             :   }
   13028             : 
   13029           1 :   if (!mFontFaceSet) {
   13030             :     return nullptr;
   13031             :   }
   13032             : 
   13033           1 :   return mFontFaceSet->GetUserFontSet();
   13034             : }
   13035             : 
   13036             : void
   13037           1 : nsIDocument::FlushUserFontSet()
   13038             : {
   13039           1 :   if (!mGetUserFontSetCalled) {
   13040             :     return; // No one cares about this font set yet, but we want to be careful
   13041             :             // to not unset our mFontFaceSetDirty bit, so when someone really
   13042             :             // does we'll create it.
   13043             :   }
   13044             : 
   13045           1 :   if (mFontFaceSetDirty) {
   13046           1 :     if (gfxPlatform::GetPlatform()->DownloadableFontsEnabled()) {
   13047             :       nsTArray<nsFontFaceRuleContainer> rules;
   13048           1 :       nsIPresShell* shell = GetShell();
   13049           1 :       if (shell && !shell->StyleSet()->AppendFontFaceRules(rules)) {
   13050             :         return;
   13051             :       }
   13052             : 
   13053           1 :       bool changed = false;
   13054             : 
   13055           1 :       if (!mFontFaceSet && !rules.IsEmpty()) {
   13056           1 :         nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowInner> window = do_QueryInterface(GetScopeObject());
   13057           1 :         mFontFaceSet = new FontFaceSet(window, this);
   13058             :       }
   13059           1 :       if (mFontFaceSet) {
   13060           1 :         changed = mFontFaceSet->UpdateRules(rules);
   13061             :       }
   13062             : 
   13063             :       // We need to enqueue a style change reflow (for later) to
   13064             :       // reflect that we're modifying @font-face rules.  (However,
   13065             :       // without a reflow, nothing will happen to start any downloads
   13066             :       // that are needed.)
   13067           1 :       if (changed && shell) {
   13068           1 :         nsPresContext* presContext = shell->GetPresContext();
   13069           1 :         if (presContext) {
   13070           1 :           presContext->UserFontSetUpdated();
   13071             :         }
   13072             :       }
   13073             :     }
   13074             : 
   13075           1 :     mFontFaceSetDirty = false;
   13076             :   }
   13077             : }
   13078             : 
   13079             : void
   13080           1 : nsIDocument::RebuildUserFontSet()
   13081             : {
   13082           1 :   if (!mGetUserFontSetCalled) {
   13083             :     // We want to lazily build the user font set the first time it's
   13084             :     // requested (so we don't force creation of rule cascades too
   13085             :     // early), so don't do anything now.
   13086           1 :     return;
   13087             :   }
   13088             : 
   13089           1 :   mFontFaceSetDirty = true;
   13090           1 :   if (nsIPresShell* shell = GetShell()) {
   13091           1 :     shell->SetNeedStyleFlush();
   13092             :   }
   13093             : 
   13094             :   // Somebody has already asked for the user font set, so we need to
   13095             :   // post an event to rebuild it.  Setting the user font set to be dirty
   13096             :   // and lazily rebuilding it isn't sufficient, since it is only the act
   13097             :   // of rebuilding it that will trigger the style change reflow that
   13098             :   // calls GetUserFontSet.  (This reflow causes rebuilding of text runs,
   13099             :   // which starts font loads, whose completion causes another style
   13100             :   // change reflow).
   13101           1 :   if (!mPostedFlushUserFontSet) {
   13102           1 :     MOZ_RELEASE_ASSERT(NS_IsMainThread());
   13103             :     nsCOMPtr<nsIRunnable> ev =
   13104           1 :       NewRunnableMethod(this, &nsIDocument::HandleRebuildUserFontSet);
   13105           1 :     if (NS_SUCCEEDED(Dispatch("nsIDocument::HandleRebuildUserFontSet",
   13106             :                               TaskCategory::Other, ev.forget()))) {
   13107           1 :       mPostedFlushUserFontSet = true;
   13108             :     }
   13109             :   }
   13110             : }
   13111             : 
   13112             : FontFaceSet*

   13385             : 
   13386             : /**
   13387             :  * Initializes |mIsThirdParty| if necessary and returns its value. The value
   13388             :  * returned represents whether this document should be considered Third-Party.
   13389             :  *
   13390             :  * A top-level document cannot be a considered Third-Party; only subdocuments
   13391             :  * may. For a subdocument to be considered Third-Party, it must meet ANY ONE
   13392             :  * of the following requirements:
   13393             :  *  - The document's parent is Third-Party
   13394             :  *  - The document has a different scheme (http/https) than its parent document
   13395             :  *  - The document's domain and subdomain do not match those of its parent
   13396             :  *    document.
   13397             :  *
   13398             :  * If there is an error in determining whether the document is Third-Party,
   13399             :  * it will be assumed to be Third-Party for security reasons.
   13400             :  */
   13401             : bool
   13402           1 : nsDocument::IsThirdParty()
   13403             : {
   13404           1 :   if (mIsThirdParty.isSome()) {
   13405           1 :     return mIsThirdParty.value();
